answers.answer: Sorry but yes! Now they might make u see a nutritionist and watch ur diet I had to take my blood sugar 4 times a day! And if that doesn't say in control they might put u on meds! Don't worry about it just keep it in control because when I had my daughter she was born with pulmonary hypertension from diabetes and it was horrible but if u ever have questions or want to talk u can message me it's a long and kinda sad story and I don't want to scare u! But she's a healthy 3 yr old now! Just contact ur doc and ask them what can u start doing today!
Yes it means you have gestational diabetes. I have type 2 diabetes so I've had this from day 1 of my pregnancy. As long as you keep you sugars where they need to be your baby will be fine.
Any suggestions on drinks n healthy meals?  Thanks for the comments! Really appreciate it!  I'm only 10 weeks...I have a long way to go!
If you're only 10 weeks why were you given the glucose test already sorry my doctors office just doesn't do it until you're between 20-28 weeks
I had one at 13 weeks because I was over weight and my np was elevated
Sorry my blood pressure was elevated
Yes mine was done early because I am over weight!

Just try and stay away from sugary foods and carbs. You do still need to eat some carbs though. If you are having a hard time controlling your sugars talk to your doctor and they will put you on meds or adjust them accordingly and sometimes that's what's best. I have to see a specialist called a perinatologist, they monitor high risk pregnancies, like people with diabetes and pregnant. I also had to see a fetal cardiologist to check my baby's heart. I'm type a 2 diabetic but I was able to manage my sugar levels very well this entire pregnancy. I'm 35 weeks and I don't have to see the cardiologist anymore cause my baby's heart is perfect. She will be on the big size around 9lbs cause of the extra insulin she got from me but they said she is gonna be very healthy. So as long as you check your sugars regularly and eat how you're supposed to your baby will be just fine. Just don't lie about your sugar levels, if they are bad then just tell your doctors and they will do what is necessary!

question: What does it exactly mean when you fail your 2nd glucose test?  Does that mean you are a diabetic?
title: Failed 2nd Glucose test
